newsitem.title: KUWAIT: KPC says Santa Fe offering successful.
newsitem.headline: KPC says Santa Fe offering successful.

text.p: State-owned Kuwait Petroleum Corp (KPC) said an initial public offering for Santa Fe International Corp shares was successful.
"Shares in Santa Fe International had been successfully placed in an initial public offering in New York," KPC said in a statement issued late on Tuesday.
"The public offering covered 35 million of the company's ordinary shares at a price of $28.5 per share," it said.
"The proceeds of the offering will be distributed to KPC."

Santa Fe operates 51 offshore and land rigs in 16 countries and the largest fleet of heavy-duty harsh environment jackup rigs in the world, in addition to three deepwater semi-submersible rigs. KPC acquired Santa Fe International Corp in 1981.
